content:
The Wolverhampton Literature Festival is a great event for book lovers, and it brings together a mix of local and national writers. In the past, the festival has hosted notable authors, including:

1. Benjamin Zephaniah - a British poet, writer, and musician who is known for his pioneering work in the field of performance poetry.

2. Malorie Blackman - a British novelist who is best known for her critically acclaimed young-adult novels, including the Noughts & Crosses series.

3. Liz Berry - a British poet who won the Forward Prize for Best First Collection in 2014.

4. David Olusoga - a British historian, writer, and broadcaster who has presented a number of documentaries on BBC, including A House Through Time and The World's War.

Aside from these notable names, the Wolverhampton Literature Festival also has a strong focus on local writers and artists. There are often events that feature local poets, writers, and musicians, giving them a platform to showcase their work and connect with other creatives.
